revised_title: X Chromosome Inactivation and its Role in Sex Chromosome Abnormalities
tldr: The article discusses the concept of X chromosome inactivation in mammals and its relation to sex chromosome abnormalities. The hypothesis of X inactivation was first proposed to explain the variegated phenotype of female mice heterozygous for X-linked color genes. The evidence for X inactivation and its role in sex chromosome abnormalities is examined, including the phenotypes of heterozygotes and the patterns produced by genes acting through somite or neural crest cells.
